org.codeseed.common.config

Class DefaultValuePropertySource

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.codeseed.common.config.DefaultValuePropertySource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PropertySource

    public class DefaultValuePropertySource
extends Object
implements PropertySource
    A property source which wraps some number of other property sources and falls back to the value in the @DefaultValue annotation. The default value can contain place holders in the form ${name[:default]}. The name can be the name of another method on the configuration interface or a system property.

    There is no stack protection: defining a cycle in default value place holders will result in a stack overflow error.

    Author:
    Jeremy Gustie

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static PropertySource create(Iterable<PropertySource> delegates)
        Creates a property source which will attempt to find default value annotations. After all of the supplied property sources fail to produce a value, the resulting property source will start evaluating default value annotations on the configuration method in order to find a value.
        Parameters:
        delegates - the property sources to consider before looking for default value annotations
        Returns:
        a property source which falls back to default values

      • create

        public static PropertySource create(PropertySource... delegates)
        Creates a property source which will attempt to find default value annotations.
        Parameters:
        delegates - the property sources to consider before looking for default value annotations
        Returns:
        a property source which falls back to default values
        See Also:
        create(Iterable)

      • getProperty

        public final String getProperty(Method method)
        Description copied from interface: PropertySource
        Returns a property value or null if no such property is defined. Properties are looked up using the method from the configuration interface on which they are defined: this allows the lookup mechanism to consider things like the method name, annotation values or the name and/or package of the declaring class.
        Specified by:
        getProperty in interface PropertySource
        Parameters:
        method - the configuration method to look up
        Returns:
        property value, null if undefined

      • getProperty

        @Nullable
protected String getProperty(Class<?> config,
                                       String name)
        Returns a property value by evaluating the supplied name. The default implementation supports three variations of the name:
        • The name of a configuration method from the current interface
        • The name of a system property
        • One of the previous values followed by a ":" and a default value
        Parameters:
        config - the current interface
        name - the name to resolve
        Returns:
        property value, null if undefined
